subject: Leadership
title: Receiving Feedback Gracefully
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Receiving Feedback Gracefully.

hook.text: A leader asks for feedback. When someone is honest, she gets defensive. The team never shares openly again. Trust dies.

buildup.text: How a leader receives feedback determines whether the team will ever give it again. One bad reaction shuts the door.

discovery.text: Sheila Heen: feedback triggers three reactionsâ€”truth triggers, relationship triggers, and identity triggers. Know yours.

twist.text: The feedback you most resist is often the feedback you most need. Defensiveness is a signal, not a shield.

climax.text: When receiving feedback: pause, thank, ask for an example, and reflect later. Never argue in the moment.

punchline.text: Leaders who can't take it can't give it.

quiz.question: What should a leader do first when receiving tough feedback?
options: Ask someone else to verify it
